member.summary: Defines values for the property indicating whether the filter expresion for blocks is to be applied as an exlude filter, an include filter, or the filter is off.

member.name: P:ACadSvg.ConversionOptions.ReverseY
member.summary: Get or sets a value indicating that the y-direction is to be reversed, i.e. y-coordinates grow from bottom to top.
member.remarks: In the SVG coordinate system y grows from top to bottom. This option allows to reverse the y-coodinates so that y grows from bottom to top and AutoCAD coordinates can be used as they are delivered.
member.value: true, when the y-direction is to be reversed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ACadSvg.ConversionOptions.ExportHandleAsID
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that an id attribute is to be created for every converted AutoCAD Entity from the entity handle (Hex).
member.value: true, when aid attributes are to be created; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ACadSvg.ConversionOptions.ExportLayerAsClass
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that a class-attribute is to created for every converted AutoCAD Entity from the name of the entity's layer.
member.value: true, when class-attributes are to created; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ACadSvg.ConversionOptions.ExportObjectTypeAsClass
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that a class>-attribute is to be created for every converted AutoCAD Entity from the object type.

member.name: T:ACadSvg.DimensionTextFormatter.MeasurementFormatterBase
member.summary: Base class for measurement formatters. Measurement formatters are used to create the parts of the measurement text such as measurement value with or without tolerance and optionally an alternate scaled measurement value with or without tolerance. Various formatters can be applied according to the specified format for linear dimension (see ) and angular dimensions (see ) respectively.

member.name: T:ACadSvg.Extensions.EntityProperties
member.summary: Base class for property classes. Propery classes provide entity properties having a standard value defined by the associated style object but may be overridden either by explicit properties of the entity object or by the entity's extended data.

remarks.para: This class provides methods to read entity's extended data. Extended data have to be interpreted as follows:

Extended data is a . Entries of type refer to an . An entry contains a list of records. The first record contains the name of a "type", e.g., DSTYLE indicating that the values of the provide property values to override values of the object.

An contains a and a . The Code indicates the type of the value. The record provides no information about the meaning of the value. We assume that the preceding record contains a group code defining the meaning of the value of this record. The group code matches the group code of the property to be overridden.

When in AutoCAD for a LEADER a custom arrowsize is set, the value appears in an entry associated with the key having the name ACAD. If an entry with the "type" record containing DSTYLE is found and a record with the group code 41 appears the following record contains the arrow-size value.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.Extensions.EntityProperties.GetExtendedDataValue``1(ACadSharp.Entities.Entity,System.String,System.String,System.Int16,``0)
member.summary: Tries to read a record from an entry with the specified () and , then tries to find a record containing the group code specified by the parameter. If the specified record was found the value of the next record is returned.
member.returns: The value from the specified record, when it was found; otherwise, the specified default value.

member.summary: Tries to read a record from an entry with the specified () and , then tries to find a record containing the group code specified by the parameter. If the specified record was found the value of the next record is a handle. The the respective is looked up and returned.
member.returns: The from the specified record, when it was found; otherwise, the specified default value. The default value may be null.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.Extensions.EntityProperties.GetExtendedDataColor(ACadSharp.Entities.Entity,System.String,System.String,System.Int16,ACadSharp.Color)
member.summary: Tries to read a record from an entry with the specified and the entry names passed in the parameter optionally suffixed with "_TC" The "_TC" suffix indicates the true-color value are provided. The suffixed entry, if present, is read first. Then tries to find a record containing the group code specified by the parameter. If the specified record was found the value of the next record is returned.
member.returns: The from the specified record, when it was found; otherwise, the specified default value.

member.name: T:ACadSvg.MTextSvg
member.summary: Represents an SVG element converted from an ACad entity. The is converted into a text element, containing one or more tspan elements.

remarks.para: The entity stores multiline text in a single string property. Paragraphs, formatting an styling is coded using a proprietary markup format. (See, e.g. https://ezdxf.readthedocs.io/en/stable/dxfinternals/entities/mtext.html).
The text is parsed end converted in a series od tspan with attributes to reflect the coded formatting and styles as good as possible.

member.name: T:ACadSvg.MultiLeaderSvg
member.summary: Represents an SVG element converted from an ACad entity. The entity is converted into a complex element including several path elements for the for the leader line and optionlly a dog-leg. A standard arrowhead can be constituted by a filled path element. member.name: T:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.CubicSpline
member.summary: Cubic spline interpolation. Call Fit (or use the corrector constructor) to compute spline coefficients, then Eval to evaluate the spline at other X coordinates.

remarks.para: This is implemented based on the wikipedia article: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spline_interpolation I'm not sure I have the right to include a copy of the article so the equation numbers referenced in comments will end up being wrong at some point.
This is not optimized, and is not MT safe. This can extrapolate off the ends of the splines. You must provide points in X sort order.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.CubicSpline.#ctor
member.summary: Default ctor.

member.summary: Construct and call Fit.
member.param: Input. X coordinates to fit.
Input. Y coordinates to fit.
Optional slope constraint for the first point. Single.NaN means no constraint.
Optional slope constraint for the final point. Single.NaN means no constraint.
Turn on console output. Default is false.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.CubicSpline.CheckAlreadyFitted
member.summary: Throws if Fit has not been called.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.CubicSpline.GetNextXIndex(System.Double)
member.summary: Find where in xOrig the specified x falls, by simultaneous traverse. This allows xs to be less than x[0] and/or greater than x[n-1]. So allows extrapolation. This keeps state, so requires that x be sorted and xs called in ascending order, and is not multi-thread safe.

member.summary: Evaluate the specified x value using the specified spline.
member.param: The x value.
Which spline to use.
Turn on console output. Default is false.
member.returns: The y value.

member.summary: Fit x,y and then eval at points xs and return the corresponding y's. This does the "natural spline" style for ends. This can extrapolate off the ends of the splines. You must provide points in X sort order.
member.param: Input. X coordinates to fit.
Input. Y coordinates to fit.
Input. X coordinates to evaluate the fitted curve at.
Optional slope constraint for the first point. Single.NaN means no constraint.
Optional slope constraint for the final point. Single.NaN means no constraint.
Turn on console output. Default is false.
member.returns: The computed y values for each xs.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.CubicSpline.Fit(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compute spline coefficients for the specified x,y points. This does the "natural spline" style for ends. This can extrapolate off the ends of the splines. You must provide points in X sort order.
member.param: Input. X coordinates to fit.
Input. Y coordinates to fit.
Optional slope constraint for the first point. Single.NaN means no constraint.
Optional slope constraint for the final point. Single.NaN means no constraint.
Turn on console output. Default is false.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.CubicSpline.Eval(System.Double[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Evaluate the spline at the specified x coordinates. This can extrapolate off the ends of the splines. You must provide X's in ascending order. The spline must already be computed before calling this, meaning you must have already called Fit() or FitAndEval().
member.param: Input. X coordinates to evaluate the fitted curve at.
Turn on console output. Default is false.
member.returns: The computed y values for each x.

member.summary: Evaluate (compute) the slope of the spline at the specified x coordinates. This can extrapolate off the ends of the splines. You must provide X's in ascending order. The spline must already be computed before calling this, meaning you must have already called Fit() or FitAndEval().
member.param: Input. X coordinates to evaluate the fitted curve at.
Turn on console output. Default is false.
member.returns: The computed y values for each x.

member.summary: Static all-in-one method to fit the splines and evaluate at X coordinates.
member.param: Input. X coordinates to fit.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.CubicSpline.FitParametric(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Fit the input x,y points using the parametric approach, so that y does not have to be an explicit function of x, meaning there does not need to be a single value of y for each x.
member.param: Input x coordinates.
Input y coordinates.
How many output points to create.
Output (interpolated) x values.
Output (interpolated) y values.

Optionally specifies the first point's slope in combination with firstDy. Together they are a vector describing the direction of the parametric spline of the starting point. The vector does not need to be normalized. If either is NaN then neither is used.
See description of dx0.

Optionally specifies the last point's slope in combination with lastDy. Together they are a vector describing the direction of the parametric spline of the last point. The vector does not need to be normalized. If either is NaN then neither is used.
See description of dxN.

member.name: T:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.TriDiagonalMatrixF
member.summary: A tri-diagonal matrix has non-zero entries only on the main diagonal, the diagonal above the main (super), and the diagonal below the main (sub).

remarks.para: This is based on the wikipedia article: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tridiagonal_matrix_algorithm

The entries in the matrix on a particular row are A[i], B[i], and C[i] where i is the row index. B is the main diagonal, and so for an NxN matrix B is length N and all elements are used. So for row 0, the first two values are B[0] and C[0]. And for row N-1, the last two values are A[N-1] and B[N-1]. That means that A[0] is not actually on the matrix and is therefore never used, and same with C[N-1].

member.name: F:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.TriDiagonalMatrixF.A
member.summary: The values for the sub-diagonal. A[0] is never used.

member.name: F:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.TriDiagonalMatrixF.B
member.summary: The values for the main diagonal.

member.name: F:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.TriDiagonalMatrixF.C
member.summary: The values for the super-diagonal. C[C.Length-1] is never used.

member.name: P:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.TriDiagonalMatrixF.N
member.summary: The width and height of this matrix.

member.name: P:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.TriDiagonalMatrixF.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Indexer. Setter throws an exception if you try to set any not on the super, main, or sub diagonals.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.TriDiagonalMatrixF.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct an NxN matrix.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.TriDiagonalMatrixF.ToDisplayString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Produce a string representation of the contents of this matrix.
member.param: Optional. For String.Format. Must include the colon. Examples are ':0.000' and ',5:0.00'
Optional. Per-line indentation prefix.

member.name: M:ACadSvg.SplineUtils.TriDiagonalMatrixF.Solve(System.Double[])
member.summary: Solve the system of equations this*x=d given the specified d.
member.remarks: Uses the Thomas algorithm described in the wikipedia article: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tridiagonal_matrix_algorithm Not optimized. Not destructive.
member.param: Right side of the equation.
